alert.note: Alert for Kimball (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 4:37PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Kimball and southeastern Laramie Counties through 415 PM MDT... At 335 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Panorama Point, or 24 miles southwest of Kimball. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, penny size hail, and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Panorama Point. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
